short_summary: Advanced contract award notice (ACAN), notification goes out to the supplier community that a contract award is anticipated for a pre-identified supplier.
description: An advanced contract award notice (ACAN) is a public notice indicating to the supplier community that a department or agency intends to award a contract for goods, services or construction to a pre-identified supplier, thereby allowing other suppliers to signal their interest in bidding, by submitting a statement of capabilities.
full_summary:
# Tender Announcement: Urban Transition Support Services

## Background
This is an advance contract award notice (ACAN) issued by the Correctional Service Canada (CSC) to provide urban transition support services to Indigenous offenders released into urban centers. The services aim to improve CSC's ability to reintegrate offenders and increase capacity to achieve gang disaffiliation among the Indigenous offender population.

## Objectives
The objectives of this tender are to:

1.  Improve CSC's ability to reintegrate Indigenous offenders.
2.  Increase CSC's capacity to achieve gang disaffiliation among the Indigenous offender population.
3.  Provide culturally appropriate gang disaffiliation support to Indigenous offenders.
4.  Support the development of release plans for offenders.

## Services to be Delivered

The contractor must deliver the following services:

1.  Gang disaffiliation support to Indigenous offenders.
2.  Traditional sharing circles and one-to-one support within correctional and community facilities.
3.  Community outreach support.
4.  Site visits to meet with offenders at recurring intervals.
5.  Regularly scheduled in-person or virtual visits to offenders who have identified themselves as wanting to participate in the gang disaffiliation program.
6.  Escort service for offenders who have been approved for escorted temporary absences.
7.  Building a regular presence within facilities of work and promoting the role and supports offered by the contractor.
8.  Providing subject matter expertise to CSC staff and contractors on gang prevention and exit strategies.
9.  Developing and updating case plans with offenders and case management teams.
10. Providing information to assist CSC personnel in developing release plans, including resources and community contacts.
11. Performing communication and coordination tasks to support the development and implementation of a release plan.
12. Assisting in developing suspension and revocation mitigation plans for Indigenous offenders in collaboration with parole officers and reintegration support service providers.
13. Advocating for offenders in applying for parole and participating in elder and community-assisted parole hearings.
14. Providing continued support to offenders on release in the community, including connecting them with community resources and providing transportation to relevant appointments.

## Requirements

The contractor must have:

1.  20 years of experience in delivering a gang exit model that assists gang-affiliated individuals to exit gang life and become successful in their communities.
